headline: Microsoft releases AI-generated Quake II demo, but admits ‘limitations’
summary: Microsoft has released a browser-based, playable level of the classic video game Quake II. This functions as a tech demo for the gaming capabilities of Microsoft’s Copilot AI platform — though by the company’s own admission, the experience isn’t quite the same as playing a well-made game. You can try it out for yourself, using your keyboard to navigate a single level of Quake II for a couple minutes before you hit the time limit. headline: Is This Artificial Intelligence IPO a Buy?
summary: Although recent stock market volatility has pushed down prices for many stocks, the artificial intelligence (AI) sector remains a compelling investment, with the tremendous transformative potential it brings to many industries.  A newcomer to the AI space is the recent initial public offering (IPO) CoreWeave (NASDAQ: CRWV).  The company went public on March 28, and AI semiconductor powerhouse Nvidia was among those that bought shares.

headline: 3 Beaten-Down Tech Stocks to Buy That Have Raised Their Dividends for 15 Years in a Row
summary: Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), Apple, and Nvidia.  It has crushed the S&P 500 over the long term, gaining 342% over the last decade compared to 145% for the index.  The technology sector has grown in value by so much that it now makes up 29.6% of the S&P 500.

headline: Elon Musk Thinks Tesla Will Become the World's Most Valuable Company, but This Glaring Problem Could Instead Lead to a 70% Plunge
summary: Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) stock ended 2024 with a gain of 63%, partly because of President Donald Trump's November U.S. election win.  Investors speculated that a looser regulatory environment -- and CEO Elon Musk's closeness with Trump and his inner circle -- could pave the way for Tesla to bring its autonomous driving and humanoid robotics platforms to market more quickly.  According to Musk, these products could make Tesla the most valuable company in the world one day -- in fact, he thinks there is a possibility it could be worth more than the next five largest companies combined.
